title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Banking and Financial Services

description.narrative: Assisting Vietnamese Development Bank in improving its capacity as the designated Small Medium Enterprise fund for Vietnam. Assisting in preparing revisions to banking laws. Assist the State Bank of Vietnam in improving the capacity of the Monetary Policy Department in the regulation of investments by commercial banks; choosing an operating target for monetary policy and the methods for setting specific targets, depending economic conditions; using repurchase agreements in managing base money. Assist the State Bank of Vietnam in improving the capacity of the Credit Department in repo market development and cooperation in other areas during the implementation of the Money Market Development Project. Advising the State Bank of Vietnam on off-site banking supervision and bank licensing and management capacity building. Advising the Government of Vietnam on the development of a deposit insurance agency.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date
Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Andrew Velthaus, Jennifer Lee, and Kelley Vito

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Budget and Financial Accountability

description.narrative: In Vietnam, the OTA Budget team plans on assisting the Ministry of Finance in designing, implementing and institutionalizing IPSAS which would include the following: Developing and recommending possible legislative changes and new accounting standards and procedures; Creating consistent budget and accounting structures; Recommending and developing organizational changes to implement IPSAS; Ensuring that the Ministry of Finance has the capacity to fully understand implement the IPSAS standards; Ensuring Ministry of Finance is able to compile data required for IPSAS cash statements; Assisting Ministry of Finance with identifying Government Business Enterprises (GBE); Training Ministry of Finance and line ministries to implement the new procedures; Providing support during roll out.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date
Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Andrew Velthaus, Jennifer Lee, and Kelley Vito

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Government Debt Issuance and Management

description.narrative: Broader, deeper primary and secondary markets for central government and sub-sovereign debt obligations. Complete understanding by government and regulatory officials of relationship of primary and secondary markets for government securities. Create efficient registry, depository, and settlement systems that support greater transaction volumes. Adoption of market-based government securities, distribution and trading practices, and standardization of domestic debt instruments. Improved communications between national and sub-sovereign government issuers, market intermediaries, and investors.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date
Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Andrew Velthaus, Jennifer Lee, and Kelley Vito

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Revenue Policy and Administration

description.narrative: Training and assistance provided to Vietnams General Department of Taxation (GDT) overhaul the existing human resources structure to better support the new functional tax organization and institutionalize anti-corruption controls. The GDT has drafted position descriptions for a three-tier technical career track for 20,000 employees. The recently-formed Tax College has taken a model leadership training class and has delivered it to field managers. OTA helped draft and then conduct trainings at the newly created Internal Investigations Department (IID) in the use of a comprehensive operational manual, the contents of which include the new Code of Employee Conduct. OTA helped finalize a procedure manual and is now conducting training for the Debt Collection Department, to systemize the process of debt collection among the 69 provinces.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date
Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Andrew Velthaus, Jennifer Lee, and Kelley Vito

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Vietnam - Banking and Financial Services

description.narrative: The resident advisor is providing technical assistance to the SBV to improve the capacity of the Monetary Policy Department in the regulation of investments by commercial banks; choosing an operating target for monetary policy and the methods for setting specific targets, depending economic conditions; using repurchase agreements in managing base money. The advisor is assisting the SBV in improving the capacity of the Credit Department in repo market development and cooperation in other areas during the implementation of the Money Market Development Project. The advisor is also assisting the Vietnamese Ministry of Finance in developing a macroeconomic analysis and forecasting model, allowing the MOF to generate forecasts of economic growth and inflation.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date
Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Andrew Velthaus, Jennifer Lee, and Kelley Vito

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Vietnam - Economic Crimes

description.narrative: ECT has committed to Customs authorities to provide customs expertise technical assistance to Customs officials in support of curriculum development for the Customs Academy. The assistance will be provided by an intermittent advisor, and will conclude the Vietnam program in 2013.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date
Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Andrew Velthaus, Jennifer Lee, and Kelley Vito

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Vietnam - Budget and Financial Accountability

description.narrative: The OTA advisor will assist the Ministry of Finance in designing, implementing and institutionalizing IPSAS with Vietnam. As both the International Monetary Fund and the World Bank are also working on IPSAS issues, the advisor will coordinate closely with both organizations to ensure there is no duplication of effort. Included, but not limited are the following actions, Legislative changes and development of new accounting standards and procedures; the budget and accounting code structures must be consistent and allow for capturing data in a format consistent with IPSAS; develop the organizational capacity to implement IPSAS; there must be institutional capacity to fully understand and implement the IPSAS standards; Data will need to be compiled in a format required for IPSAS financial statements; Government business Enterprises (GBE) must be identified; training will be needed to implement new procedures; support will be needed during the rollout.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date
Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Andrew Velthaus, Jennifer Lee, and Kelley Vito

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Vietnam - Government Debt Issuance and Management

description.narrative: This GDIM intermittent project is working with the Ministry of Finance's Debt Management Office (DMO) to consolidate existing domestic issuers of government guaranteed debt within the DMO's operations. Additional assistance supports the development of a MOF debt issuance strategy that addresses increased demand for shorter maturities, the creation an efficient price discovery mechanism for Treasury Bills, the development of a trade reporting system, reforms to the primary dealer system including dealer selection and performance monitoring, development of a technical methodology to quantify liability portfolio risks, and building DMO staff capacity to conduct all facets of debt issuance and management responsibilities.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date
Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Andrew Velthaus, Jennifer Lee, and Kelley Vito

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Vietnam - Revenue Policy and Administration

description.narrative: Training and assistance provided to Vietnams General Department of Taxation (GDT) overhaul the existing human resources structure to better support the new functional tax organization and institutionalize anti-corruption controls. The GDT has drafted position descriptions for a three-tier technical career track for 20,000 employees. The recently-formed Tax College has taken a model leadership training class and has delivered it to field managers. OTA helped draft and then conduct trainings at the newly created Internal Investigations Department (IID) in the use of a comprehensive operational manual, the contents of which include the new Code of Employee Conduct. OTA helped finalize a procedure manual and is now conducting training for the Debt Collection Department, to systemize the process of debt collection among the 69 provinces. Reform of the HR process, supporting: workforce allocation, employee motivation, skill advancement.

person-name.narrative: Andrew Velthaus, Jennifer Lee, and Kelley Vito

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Banking and Financial Services

description.narrative: The advisor is providing technical assistance to the SBV to improve the capacity of the Monetary Policy Department in the regulation of investments by commercial banks; choosing an operating target for monetary policy and the methods for setting specific targets, depending economic conditions; using repurchase agreements in managing base money. The advisor is assisting the SBV in improving the capacity of the Credit Department in repo market development and cooperation in other areas during the implementation of the Money Market Development Project. The advisor is also assisting the Vietnamese Ministry of Finance in developing a macroeconomic analysis and forecasting model, allowing the MOF to generate forecasts of economic growth and inflation. Assist the Ministry of Economic and Finance in the development of their Insurance Regulation framework.

description.narrative: The OTA advisor will assist the Ministry of Finance in designing, implementing and institutionalizing IPSAS with Vietnam. As both the International Monetary Fund and the World Bank are also working on IPSAS issues, the advisor will coordinate closely with both organizations to ensure there is no duplication of effort. Included, but not limited are the following actions, Legislative changes and development of new accounting standards and procedures; the budget and accounting code structures must be consistent and allow for capturing data in a format consistent with IPSAS; develop the organizational capacity to implement IPSAS; there must be institutional capacity to fully understand and implement the IPSAS standards; Data will need to be compiled in a format required for IPSAS financial statements; Government business Enterprises (GBE) must be identified; training will be needed to implement new procedures; support will be needed during the rollout.

person-name.narrative: Andrew Velthaus, Jennifer Lee, and Kelley Vito

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Budget and Financial Accountability - Vietnam

description.narrative: The goal of this project is to strengthen public financial management for the effective and efficient management of funds to help sustain Vietnam's economic growth and poverty reduction achievements and meet critical government service delivery needs. Project components include: 1) enhancing whole-of-government accrual-based financial statements to more accurately and transparently demonstrate the government's financial position; 2) updating payment processes and procedures to decrease processing time for financial transactions and improve financial controls; and 3) improving cash management and decreasing the risk of cash shortages.

person-name.narrative: Andrew Velthaus, Jennifer Lee, and Kelley Vito

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Budget and Financial Accountability - Vietnam

description.narrative: The goal of this project is to strengthen public financial management for the effective and efficient management of funds to help sustain Vietnam's economic growth and poverty reduction achievements and meet critical government service delivery needs. Project components include: 1) enhancing whole-of-government accrual-based financial statements to more accurately and transparently demonstrate the government's financial position; 2) updating payment processes and procedures to decrease processing time for financial transactions and improve financial controls; and 3) improving cash management and decreasing the risk of cash shortages.

person-name.narrative: Andrew Velthaus, Jennifer Lee, and Kelley Vito

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Economic Crimes

description.narrative: ECT has committed to Customs authorities to provide customs expertise technical assistance to Customs officials in support of curriculum development for the Customs Academy. The assistance will be provided by an intermittent advisor, and will conclude the Vietnam program in 2013.

person-name.narrative: Andrew Velthaus, Jennifer Lee, and Kelley Vito

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Government Debt Issuance and Management

description.narrative: This GDIM intermittent project is working with the Ministry of Finance's Debt Management Office (DMO) to consolidate existing domestic issuers of government guaranteed debt within the DMO's operations. Additional assistance supports the development of a MOF debt issuance strategy that addresses increased demand for shorter maturities, the creation an efficient price discovery mechanism for Treasury Bills, the development of a trade reporting system, reforms to the primary dealer system including dealer selection and performance monitoring, development of a technical methodology to quantify liability portfolio risks, and building DMO staff capacity to conduct all facets of debt issuance and management responsibilities.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date
Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Andrew Velthaus, Jennifer Lee, and Kelley Vito

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Government Debt & Infrastructure Finance - Vietnam IFT

description.narrative: This project will provide TA to Vietnam Electricity (EVN), a state-owned enterprise (SOE) that reports directly to the Prime Minister. The Advisor will provide technical assistance to EVN to (1) develop an analytical framework to support EVNs assessment of opportunities in asset divestment and alternatives for raising funds; (2) develop financial and legal structures needed for implementation of strategic partnerships, acquisitions, tenders and refinancing for designated divestments; (3) develop strategies to access domestic and international capital markets by issuing corporate debt; (4) design and structure projects eligible for Green Bonds designation; (5) develop institutional capacity programs for the Finance and Accounting Department; and, (6) strengthen relationships between EVN and other donor agencies and MDBs.

person-name.narrative: Andrew Velthaus, Jennifer Lee, and Kelley Vito

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Revenue Policy and Administration

description.narrative: Training and assistance provided to Vietnams General Department of Taxation (GDT) overhaul the existing human resources structure to better support the new functional tax organization and institutionalize anti-corruption controls. The GDT has drafted position descriptions for a three-tier technical career track for 20,000 employees. The recently-formed Tax College has taken a model leadership training class and has delivered it to field managers. OTA helped draft and then conduct trainings at the newly created Internal Investigations Department (IID) in the use of a comprehensive operational manual, the contents of which include the new Code of Employee Conduct. OTA helped finalize a procedure manual and is now conducting training for the Debt Collection Department, to systemize the process of debt collection among the 69 provinces. Reform of the HR process, supporting: workforce allocation, employee motivation, skill advancement.

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Vietnam - Revenue Policy and Administration

description.narrative: Training and assistance provided to Vietnams General Department of Taxation (GDT) to overhaul the existing human resources structure to better support the new functional tax organization and institutionalize anti-corruption controls. The GDT has drafted position descriptions for a three-tier technical career track for 20,000 employees. The recently-formed Tax College has taken a model leadership training class and has delivered it to field managers. OTA helped draft and then conduct trainings at the newly created Internal Investigations Department (IID) in the use of a comprehensive operational manual, the contents of which include the new Code of Employee Conduct. OTA helped finalize a procedure manual and has provided training for the Debt Collection Department, to systemize the process of debt collection among the 69 provinces. Reform of the HR process, supporting: workforce allocation, employee motivation, skill advancement.

person-name.narrative: Andrew Velthaus, Jennifer Lee, and Kelley Vito

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Vietnam - Budget and Financial Accountability

description.narrative: The OTA advisor will assist the Ministry of Finance in designing, implementing and institutionalizing IPSAS with Vietnam. As both the International Monetary Fund and the World Bank are also working on IPSAS issues, the advisor will coordinate closely with both organizations to ensure there is no duplication of effort. Included, but not limited are the following actions, Legislative changes and development of new accounting standards and procedures; the budget and accounting code structures must be consistent and allow for capturing data in a format consistent with IPSAS; develop the organizational capacity to implement IPSAS; there must be institutional capacity to fully understand and implement the IPSAS standards; Data will need to be compiled in a format required for IPSAS financial statements; Government business Enterprises (GBE) must be identified; training will be needed to implement new procedures; support will be needed during the rollout.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date
Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date
